author: dapplion
content: Q for CL implementors: How are you pruning BlsToExecution changes from the op pool? Naive solution is to prune once a state finalizes, iterate over pending changes and drop the once already applied. However retrieving the finalized state is not cheap in all cases so would prefer to avoid. CC <@792822129019584562>

author: potuz
content: We remove from the pool any objects we have seen in blocks and reinsert them on reorgs
